intro: Uvularia parviflora, commonly known as the smallflower bellvista, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the豆科 (Fabaceae) family, characterized by its typical legume structure. The plant produces small, bell-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets. Uvularia parviflora thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
